intro: Phoradendron pinheirense, commonly known as the Brazilian mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant belonging to the family Viscaraceae. It grows on the branches of host trees, primarily in the Atlantic Forest of Brazil, and derives some of its nutrients from the host through specialized roots. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers and red berries that are important for local bird species. Its leaves are evergreen, and it has a symbiotic relationship with certain species of ants. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is a subject of conservation efforts.
